book_list.author: Harper Lee
book_list.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
book_list.excerpt: A novel about the childhood observations of a young girl named Scout, whose father, a lawyer, is appointed to defend a black man accused of rape.

book_list.author: George Orwell
book_list.excerpt: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian regime of the future, where the truth is what the government says it is, and thoughts are policed.

book_list.author: Jane Austen
book_list.title: Pride and Prejudice
book_list.excerpt: A romantic novel of manners that explores the character of Elizabeth Bennet, intelligent and witty, and her relationship with the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

book_list.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
book_list.title: The Great Gatsby
book_list.excerpt: A novel set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, near New York City, it is a critique of the American Dream.

book_list.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
book_list.title: The Hobbit
book_list.excerpt: The prelude to the Lord of the Rings, The Hobbit follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.
